text: hey everybody thomas joseph here with
another kitchen conundrum last
Thanksgiving did your pumpkin pie turn
out like this sunken in the middle maybe
with some big cracks in the center and
this liquid on top maybe even an under
baked crust on the bottom well today I'm
going to show you how to avoid all of
that and make a perfect pumpkin pie for
this Thanksgiving it all starts with the
crust for an easy crimped edge all you
have to do is you have to fold the crust
under slightly you're building up the
edge so that you have something to crimp
so now using well floured fingers for a
nice crimped edge I like to use my thumb
my other thumb and my pointer finger and
you're gently going to press the crust
into a crimped or fluted edge just like
that you want to do this quickly so that
you can get it right into the
refrigerator and you're going to chill
this crust until it's nice and firm
about 30 minutes so the crust is nice
and cold very very firm and this is
really the first step in creating the
perfect pumpkin pie and that is blind
baking it and blind baking is a process
of pre baking the pie shell so that it's
nice and crisp and you don't end up with
an uncooked soggy bottom crust so I have
a piece of parchment take the parchment
and crinkle it up you're making the
paper a little bit more flexible a
little bit more malleable and crinkling
this up makes it much easier to fit into
the pie shell in all of the nooks and
crannies and now take some baking beans
or pie weights whatever you have on hand
and fill this up and this process
ensures that the crust itself doesn't
bubble up and the shape doesn't change
so this goes into a 375-degree oven and
you're going to cook with the beans for
about 30 minutes make sure that the
bottom crust here is set before you
remove this so that the whole crust can
Brown
even leave for about another ten maybe
fifteen minutes so the blind bake pie
shell is out of the oven it's still hot
and a trick here in making sure that the
filling doesn't seep into your crust and
make it soggy is to brush while it's
still warm
with a little bit of egg white it kind
of cooks slightly on the pie shell and
creates a barrier so that the filling
doesn't soak into the crust you can come
up the side slightly and then let this
cool completely before you add the
filling so now for the filling I have
one 15 ounce can of pumpkin puree I'm
going to add three large eggs and
whenever you are cracking eggs make sure
that you crack them on a flat surface as
opposed to the side of the bowl you're
less likely to get shell in your eggs if
you crack on a flat surface versus on
the side of the bowl little trick for
you I didn't know if you knew that so
these go right in to the pumpkin here
and one teaspoon of vanilla vanilla adds
really great flavor one tablespoon of
cornstarch and cornstarch helps thicken
the filling a 1/2 teaspoon of kosher
salt and salt is very important when
you're baking it helps to bring out all
of those natural flavors so make sure
that you use salt 3/4 of a teaspoon of
ground ginger 3/4 of a teaspoon of
ground cinnamon so these are very
typical classic pumpkin pie spices and a
quarter teaspoon of freshly grated
nutmeg and that is probably 10 to 12
maybe even 15 little swipes on this
microplane here and to this we need to
add a little bit of sweetness so I have
3/4 of a cup of light brown sugar that
has been packed and start to stir this
together and now add 1 12 ounce can of
evaporated milk sweetened condensed milk
is much thicker and it's very high in
sugar so just evaporated milk whisk
until it's nicely combined and now we're
ready to fill our pie shell have your
oven preheated to 325 degrees whenever
you have a custard and this filling is
considered a custard like filling a
lower temperature will guarantee your
pumpkin filling won't souffle up too
much and then kind of collapse as it
cools so low and slow 50 to 55 minutes
when it comes out of the oven make sure
that you cool it on a wire rack until it
comes to room temperature before
refrigerating for at least 6 hours or up
to overnight that long process of
cooling the pie helps to ensure that you
don't get any of these unsightly cracks
and also the Weeping which is the water
that cools on the top so if you do it
correctly you'll end up with something
that looks like this and I'm going to
cut into this pie because I can't wait
to taste it and use one of these offset
knives it's really great for slicing
pies of cakes I'm gonna go right in the
center here it's always really helpful
to wipe the blade of your knife with a
damp towel in between cuts and I'm going
to try and sneak one piece out here if
your pie is really well chilled it
should come out perfectly serve it with
a little bit of sweetened whipped cream
and there you have it the perfect
pumpkin pie recipe I encourage you to
try this recipe for your Thanksgiving
meal
you
